title: MobileCause Webinar To Map Out Nonprofit Playbook for #GivingTuesday 2015 Success
text:
Learning & Support MobileCause Webinar To Map Out Nonprofit Playbook for #GivingTuesday 2015 Success Winning strategies and practical tactics to get the most out of this year's global day of giving will be the focus of this next installment in MobileCause webinar series for nonprofit leaders. ET | Source: MobileCause photo-release 
CALABASAS, Calif., Oct. 5, 2015 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- MobileCause , the world's best "mobile first" fundraising and communications platform for nonprofits, announces " #GivingTuesday Playbook Webinar ", the next installment in their thought leading series designed to help nonprofit leaders unlock their organization's potential to reach their fundraising goals. Scheduled for October 6th at 11AM PST , the webinar will reveal how organizations can successfully leverage #GivingTuesday's one-day event to kick off their 2015 giving season. #GivingTuesday Playbook webinar topics will include: Taking advantage of national publicity and momentum Making it easy for new donors to participate Crowdfunding to gain new donors and empowering teams Building relationships with local businesses Utilizing a matching fund 
The distinguished and influential speakers that MobileCause has gathered for this informative webinar will present valuable insights and best practices that nonprofits can use to build their own #GivingTuesday playbook for dynamic end-of-year success. Speakers include: Beth Kanter, #GivingTuesday Influencer, Beth's Blog Beau Slater, Wilmington College Katie Keating, United Way Strategist Jeremy Koenig, MobileCause 
In addition to sharing their expert observations, advice and stories of campaign success, the panel will also discuss how mobile-friendly solutions will make it easy for supporters of nonprofits to give and volunteer on December 1st, this year's #GivingTuesday. "Giving Tuesday's perfect union of focused media and global attention around giving and philanthropy presents nonprofits with an excellent opportunity to significantly boost fundraising and awareness for their cause in a very concentrated period of time," commented Jessica Bernstein, MobileCause Marketing Manager. "A mobile strategy will help them to easily grow their donor database, raise more money and reach their end-of-year goals so they can start 2016 renewed and confident that they can do it again in the new year." About MobileCause 
MobileCause is the world's best "mobile first" fundraising and donor communication platform for nonprofits. A fully integrated suite of products powers a new generation of giving that is designed to be powerful, simple and secure. We mobilize networks of volunteers, donors and staff, while making it easy for people to give and stay connected from any device. Nonprofits raise more donations while saving time and resources with a powerful set of solutions that include: Crowdfunding and Peer to Peer Campaigns, Event Registration, Ticketing and Fundraising, Sign-up, Survey, Petition and Membership Forms, Digital Fundraising and Mobile Marketing. MobileCause also provides turnkey merchant services with zero transaction fees and an industry low flat-rate credit card processing fee that includes a specialized mobile payment app to collect in-person donations. Dedicated strategy support from fundraising experts look after clients that include United Way, The Salvation Army, American Heart Association, University of Southern California, Habitat for Humanity and many more. Learn more at www.mobilecause.com
